creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Mr and Mrs Makiji Hase
description: black shrimp facing upward with two outstretched feelers at L; three shells to R of shrimp at bottom; inscription R side
inscription: R side: 無時不獲魚・有酒当啖・万里大江流百年長垂釣・髯漁 (There\'s never time when I can\'t catch fish, / When I have wine they\'re fine to eat. / The river flows ten thousand li, / For a hundred years, I fish with my long pole.) (SA)
title: Treasures of the River
